unnormalised: Mumbai: Word on the street is, Paytm stock took a tumble today, down by 7.5% to ₹850. Some folks are saying it’s due to the RBI's recent announcements, but who really knows? Market's always got its own drama, right?
normalised: Mumbai: Word on the street is, P-aytm stock took a tumble today, down by approximately seven point five percent to rupee eight hundred and fifty. Some folks are saying it’s due to the R-B-I's recent announcements, but who really knows? Market's always got its own drama, right?

unnormalised: Analysts at ICICI Direct are still giving it a "buy" rating, with a target price of ₹1200. Bold move, considering everything. They're banking on Paytm's growth in the digital payments space, especially with UPI becoming the king. I guess we'll see if their optimism pays off.
normalised: Analysts at I-C-I-C-I Direct are still giving it a "buy" rating, with a target price of rupee one thousand two hundred. Bold move, considering everything. They're banking on P-aytm's growth in the digital payments space, especially with U-P-I becoming the king. I guess we'll see if their optimism pays off.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, those who invested in Zomato's IPO back in '21 must be feeling pretty good. The stock's been on a roll, hitting a new high of Rs. 180. Not bad for a company that was once struggling to turn a profit. Proof that patience (and a little bit of luck) can pay off in the stock market.
normalised: Meanwhile, those who invested in Zomato's I-P-O back in two thousand twenty one must be feeling pretty good. The stock's been on a roll, hitting a new high of rupees one hundred and eighty. Not bad for a company that was once struggling to turn a profit. Proof that patience (and a little bit of luck) can pay off in the stock market.

unnormalised: Gold prices are also making headlines. 24K gold is currently trading at ₹72,000 per 10 grams. Seems like everyone's rushing to buy gold as a safe haven, given all the uncertainty around. Remember those days when gold was only around Rs. 30,000? Feels like a lifetime ago.
normalised: Gold prices are also making headlines. twenty four K gold is currently trading at rupee seventy two thousand per ten grams. Seems like everyone's rushing to buy gold as a safe haven, given all the uncertainty around. Remember those days when gold was only around rupees thirty thousand? Feels like a lifetime ago.
